rules: Rule1: If a person uses a drug, then that drug is approved.
Rule2: Either a person violates a protocol, or if a regulator investigates a drug, then the regulator does not reject that drug.
Rule3: Under the condition that a person notifies a regulator, the material is destroyed.
Rule4: Provided that a person reports an incident, then either a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.
Rule5: If a person is responsible for a process, then the person must either notify a regulator or report an incident.
Rule6: Whenever a person produces a material, the person uses a drug.
Rule7: If a regulator suspends production, then provided that a drug is not approved, the drug is not safe.
Rule8: Under the condition that a regulator halts production, then if a drug is not approved, the drug is not safe.
Rule9: Provided that a regulator conducts an audit, the regulator completes an investigation.
Rule10: A regulator conducts an audit, or a regulator issues a warning.
Rule11: Whenever a regulator issues a warning, the regulator halts production.
Rule12: If a regulator completes an investigation, then the regulator suspends production.
Rule13: If a researcher develops a formula, then the researcher publishes results.
Rule14: Provided that a researcher patents a formula, then if it is not the case that synthesizing a drug implies either testing the drug or producing a material, the drug is not effective.
Rule15: If a researcher publishes results, then the researcher patents a formula.
Rule16: A material is imported from a country, or a regulator approves a drug.
Rule17: Under the condition that a regulator bans an import, the material is not imported from a country.

Rule18: Provided that a regulator inspects a facility, then either the facility quarantines a material, or a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.
Rule19: A regulator inspects a facility, or a regulator monitors a process.
Rule20: Under the condition that an agency certifies a facility, the facility is accredited.

Rule21: An agency certifies a facility, or if a regulator monitors a process, then either a facility quarantines a material, or a drug is recalled, or if it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is not hazardous.
Rule22: Provided that a facility is accredited, the facility is compliant.
Rule23: If a facility is accredited, then the facility is not compliant.
Rule24: If a technician detects contamination, then if the material is toxic, the drug is not safe.
Rule25: A technician detects contamination, or a technician identifies a defect.
Rule26: If a person analyzes a material, then the person either tests a drug or produces a material.
Rule27: A person analyzes a material, or a person synthesizes a drug.
Rule28: Under the condition that a technician identifies a defect, then if the material is toxic, the drug is not safe.
Rule29: If a person synthesizes a drug, then the person purifies the drug.
Rule30: Provided that a person purifies a drug, the person either tests the drug or produces a material.
Rule31: If a regulator approves a drug, then if the drug is not approved, the material does not contaminate the drug.
Rule32: If it is not the case that a defective material implies a quality failure, then the material is hazardous.
Rule33: If it is not the case that synthesizing a drug implies either testing the drug or producing a material, then the drug is effective.
Rule34: Whenever a regulator does not approve a drug, the regulator investigates the drug.
Rule35: If a regulator does not approve a drug, then the regulator rejects the drug.
Rule36: If a drug is not approved, then the material is defective.
Rule37: Provided that a drug is not approved, the drug is safe.
Rule38: If a drug is not approved, then the material is toxic.
Rule39: Under the condition that a drug is not approved, the material contaminates the drug.
facts: Fact1: A person is responsible for a process.
Fact2: A researcher develops a formula.
Fact3: A regulator bans an import.
Fact4: It is not the case that a person violates a protocol.
Fact5: A material does not fail quality standards.
Fact6: A drug is not recalled.
Fact7: A material is not destroyed.
Fact8: A person does not test a drug.
Fact9: A facility does not quarantine a material.
